page.title: 10The landscape in this survey
page.content: The general landscape in this area is one of flatness,the only hill being at Flawborough where the whole village is situated at the top of the hill giving a good view of the rest of the area. Flawborough also is more of a 'prairie' type of landscape due to hedge removal to give large areas of arable farmland.The area containing the gypsum works create an untidy landscape with its factory for processing on the one hand,reclaimed fields with newly planted trees on the other.Where the works which has recently ceased to operate are abandonned buildings and excavation sites which are scarring the countryside until reclamation and screening are carried out and the land returned to farming use.Diseased trees are gradually being replaced by replanting schemes.
